author: National Bureau
text:
The BJP will hold a two-day National Executive meet here from March 19 to 20, where the party will flesh out its stand on national issues and also take stock of organisational issues.

The meet comes soon after Amit Shah earning a full three-year stint as party chief after some outstanding electoral successes followed by a debacle in Delhi and Bihar.

The party is also faced with students unrest in Hyderabad University and the JNU, with its ramifications being felt in Parliament too.

It may have to brainstorm on the JNU crisis, where the government has struck down on some student activists after objectionable slogans were raised there at a meet in the memory of Afzal Guru.

The party has also to take stock of agitations for Jat quotas in Haryana — its core group met on Friday to discuss the fallout — and the demand for Patel reservation in Gujarat.

It faces key polls in 2016 and 2017, including Assam, Punjab — where there is already a political crisis since alleged desecrations of the Guru Granth Saheb months back — Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat.
title: BJP national executive to meet on March 19, 20
